p: All the plant materials were air-dried in the shade for 7 days at room temperature and powdered using a mortar and pestle to get particles of a uniform, reduced size. Preparation of the essential oil samples was achieved by hydrodistillation of the air-dried aerial parts of the different Ferula species, F. caratavica ( Fc), F. kuchistanica (Fk), F. pseudoreoselinum ( Fp), F. samarcandica ( Fs), F. tenuisecta (Ft) and F. varia ( Fv) for 2 h by Clevenger-type apparatus. Anhydrous Na 2SO 4 was used to dehydrate the prepared essential oils, yielding 0.4, 0.7, 0.3, 0.3, 0.8 and 0.5 % v/w of dry weight for Fc, Fk, Fp, Fs, Ft and Fv, respectively. Then the various oil samples were maintained at −30 °C in dark-colored stoppered glasses until their analyses [ 26, 27].
